result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas A Pietrantonio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 19 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Case 14CM1889, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Cases 15CM104 and 15CM1136 were dismissed and read in.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas A Pietrantonio

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Civil Judgment filed by Dept. of Corrections.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Received and filed in court by the State.

Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Douglas A Pietrantonio in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 dismissed as read ins.

Court orders the following:
6  Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
Concurrent with:  14CM1889
19 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:    18 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.


Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Douglas A Pietrantonio in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has received discovery and pretrial offers on all cases.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint, unless his mother and step father consent in writing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Douglas A Pietrantonio in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
